unnormalised: Okay, here's the synthetic data generated based on the provided parameters:
normalised: What's the correct way to address a letter to the Reserve Bank of India (R-B-I)? Good question! Knowing the proper address format for government and institutional entities like the R-B-I can be surprisingly useful. A correctly addressed letter ensures faster delivery and a more professional impression. It shows you've paid attention to detail. Often, people just write "R-B-I, Mumbai" but that's too vague.

unnormalised: What's the correct way to address a letter to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI)? Good question! Knowing the proper address format for government and institutional entities like the RBI can be surprisingly useful. A correctly addressed letter ensures faster delivery and a more professional impression. It shows you've paid attention to detail. Often, people just write "RBI, Mumbai" but that's too vague.
normalised: Generally, for official correspondence with the Reserve Bank of India, you'd want to address it to a specific department or officer if you know who needs to receive it. However, if it's a general enquiry, you can address it to: Reserve Bank of India, [Name of the specific office location, e.g., Mumbai, Delhi, Chennai, Kolkata], [Full Address of the Office], [Pincode]. For example, for the Mumbai office, you can use Reserve Bank of India, Mumbai, Shahid Bhagat Singh Road, Fort, Mumbai four hundred thousand and one. Remember to always double-check the R-B-I's website (r-b-i dot org dot in) for the most up-to-date address information, especially if you're dealing with a regional office.

However, if it's a general enquiry, you can address it to: Reserve Bank of India, [Name of the specific office location, e.g., Mumbai, Delhi, Chennai, Kolkata], [Full Address of the Office], [Pincode]. normalised: Keep in mind that different departments may have different postal addresses within the same city. For instance, the Department of Banking Regulation might have a slightly different address or a specific floor/building within the R-B-I complex. Also, while physical letters are still used, consider whether an email to the relevant department would be a faster and more efficient way to communicate. Their website, R-B-I dot org dot in typically lists the correct email I-Ds. So, always verify before sending to avoid delays!
